newsitem.title: EGYPT: Arab MP envoy on Kuwait-Iraq reconciliation trip.
newsitem.headline: Arab MP envoy on Kuwait-Iraq reconciliation trip.

text.p: The head of the Arab Parliamentary Union said on Wednesday he would visit Iraq and Kuwait next month on a mission to mend ties strained by Baghdad's 1990 invasion of the oil-rich Gulf state.

Secretary-General Galal Saeed told reporters after meeting Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak in Cairo he had received letters from both Iraq and Kuwait "which asserted the willingness of both sides to open the issue of their relations."
"The union decided to send an envoy during its last meeting (in May) and I will go to both countries next month on a reconciliation mission on behalf of the union," Saeed added.
Gulf Arab states sided with a U.S.-led multinational force to liberate Kuwait in 1991 and five years later many still refuse to sit at the same table with Iraqi representatives.
Iraq was not invited to the 1996 Cairo Arab Summit, the first to be held since the Kuwait invasion.
